result.title: Help on solving "Travelling Delivery Person"
result.content:
Hi!

I'm fairly new to competetive programming, and recently started solving some graph problems on Kattis.

I came over the following problem a few days ago, but I'm really not sure how I can represent and construct this kind of a graph where I have to account the direction we are moving in.

After constructing it "correctly", I thought Floyd-Warshall would be a good choice to find the minimum distance between each intersection that contains a package... does that sound like a bad idea?

I haven't solved this kind of a graph problems before, so any help would be really appreciated!
